subject: Re: Test naming conventions (was Re: [junit] Unit Testing question)
msgSnippet: ... I try to have the method name give some indication of what /should/ happen. testStackShouldContainOneElementAfterPush
messageBody:
On 3/1/06, jason r tibbetts <tibbettj@...> wrote:
>
>
> On that note, what conventions does everyone here use to name their test
> methods? For this example, mine would look like:
>
> test_push_emptyStack()
> test_push_stackWith1Element()
> test_push_fullStack()
> test_push_nullElement()
>
> in other words,
> "test" + /primary/ method under test + scenario description
>
>
I try to have the method name give some indication of what /should/ happen.

testStackShouldContainOneElementAfterPush
testStackShouldContainTwoElementsAfterTwoPushes

The discipline of coming up with a sentence with /should/ in it helps me to
focus on what the test is really testing. I was surprised by how effective
this turned out to be.

Kevin
